intro: Myosotis lytteltonensis, commonly known as the Lyttelton forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its leaves are oval-shaped and covered in a fine, hairy texture. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators.
